title: LY2062430: Multiple-Dose Safety in Subjects With Mild-to-Moderate Alzheimer's Disease and Single-Dose Safety in Healthy Volunteers
description_brief: To study the safety of LY2062430 in patients with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's disease and in healthy volunteers.
drug: LY2062430 (solanezumab) — humanized monoclonal IgG1 antibody that binds the mid-domain of amyloid-β (soluble Aβ) to promote clearance.
explanation_target: Reason: The investigational agent LY2062430 is solanezumab, a humanized monoclonal antibody directed at soluble amyloid‑β (Aβ) intended to alter Aβ levels/clearance — i.e., it targets Alzheimer’s pathology, consistent with a disease‑modifying biologic. citeturn0search1turn0search4

Act: Key trial details extracted from the description and sources: multiple‑dose safety testing in patients with mild‑to‑moderate AD and single‑dose safety in healthy volunteers; randomized placebo‑controlled studies were performed. Sources describing the Phase I/II safety studies and mechanism: Eli Lilly press release and Phase I/II publications and trial summaries. citeturn0search0turn0search1turn0search3

Reflect: Classification check — because LY2062430/solanezumab is a monoclonal antibody (a biologic) that specifically targets amyloid‑β pathology, it fits the 'disease‑targeted biologic' category. Note: later larger trials did not show meaningful cognitive benefit in mild‑to‑moderate AD, but that does not change the intervention type or intended disease‑targeting mechanism. citeturn0search6turn0search2

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational agent LY2062430 (solanezumab) is a humanized monoclonal IgG1 that binds the mid‑domain of amyloid‑β and preferentially engages soluble Aβ to alter its clearance — i.e., the drug directly targets amyloid‑β pathology. citeturn0search3turn0search4turn0search0

Act: Extracted details — drug: LY2062430 (solanezumab); modality: disease‑targeted biologic (monoclonal antibody); mechanism: binds mid‑region/central residues of Aβ (soluble monomers) to increase clearance and shift Aβ equilibria between brain, CSF and plasma. These details map directly to CADRO category A (Amyloid beta). citeturn0search4turn0search5

Reflect: Solanezumab’s stated mechanism is specific to amyloid‑β (soluble Aβ), not to tau, inflammation, synaptic targets, or a multi‑target approach — therefore the most specific CADRO classification is A) Amyloid beta. (Note: later clinical outcomes do not change the mechanistic target classification.) citeturn0search2turn0search3
